review_title: Great Place to work but the pay is a bit on the low side.

cons: The pay is a little bit on the low side.

review_title: Gone is the feeling of "Family"....now it's all about the bottom line...
pros: Established regional name.  Good communication between Administration and associates.
cons: Since Ascension Healthcare (National group) took over the facility, there has been an almost constant decline in associate morale.   Gradually benefits are reduced, several entire departments have been outsourced. (the trend with Ascension)   Significant amount of lay-offs and terminations, highly publicized in local media.  This will gain them the bottom line they are looking for, but at what cost?  Who will suffer the most?   THE PATIENTS.    These radical and unwarranted lay-offs will only continue to reduce morale and associate dedication.   The delivery of healthcare here is most certainly not what it used to be.   That is why so many local folks are having procedures at other area hospitals/clinics...sometimes traveling as far at 30+ miles North.

pros: The hospital is very supportive of the employees, and the managers are all very passionate about their units and those working for them.  This spills out onto the units and there is passion from the nurses also.
cons: Just as with all healthcare facilities at this time there are cuts in budgets, and thankfully the hospital is working it out so no one has to lose their position.  This however makes it so you have to be creative and work more with less.

pros: The place still has pockets of expertise only found in large cities.  Some specialist are truly world class doctors. Have many friends who have had their lives saved by doctors there
cons: The change in ownership has destroyed the culture there. Administration does not care about staff, doctors nor the community. Lifepoint corporate in Tennessee are despicable people only concerned about money with little regard for people. Local people and CEO has almost no power

pros: Very friendly environment. They aren't joking when they say that its like a family. Everyone is very kind and uplifting.
cons: The area is a little bad. Paterson can be somewhat scary at night but they do a good job with security around the hospital.

job_title: RN Clinical Care Coordinator in Lewiston, ID

cons: Need additional surgeons and speciality physicians to increase daily census. SJRMC is actively recruiting however

pros: Lots of wonderful employees to work with
